intro: Siphocampylus longibracteolatus, commonly known as the long-bract evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in the evening. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical structure includes a slender, branched stem and yellow to orange flowers with five petals. Siphocampylus longibracteolatus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
